about.name: I'm Nive!
about.tagline: Engineer, AI builder, MBA candidate, and Mom.
about.bio:
_Structural Engineer_ ‚Üí _NYU Stern MBA (Business Analytics, Strategy, Technology Product Management)_
---
I started my career as a Structural Engineer, designing and managing water infrastructure systems that quietly keep entire cities running. What drew me to engineering back then is still true today: I love breaking down complexity, making sense of data, and building systems that work in the real world.
In 2023, I began my MBA at **NYU Stern**, specializing in Business Analytics, Strategy, and Technology Product Management. That‚Äôs where my curiosity for AI really took off. I became fascinated by how engineering logic, product thinking, and data-driven decision-making come together to create smarter, more resilient organizations.
Since then, I‚Äôve worked on projects ranging from AI-powered product design and climate-tech pricing models to construction-tech strategy and machine learning workflows. Across every space, one thing stays the same: I love turning ambiguity into structure, and structure into solutions people actually use.
Motherhood has added an unexpected and meaningful layer to my journey. Balancing a full-time career, graduate school, and raising a tiny human taught me resilience, empathy, and the power of small, consistent progress. It changed how I lead, how I build, and what I value in the work I choose to do.
Outside of work, you'll find me baking something sweet, hiking with my family, or inventing new toddler activities for my son. You'll also find me experimenting with AI tools and side projects ‚Äî anything that blends curiosity with creativity and makes everyday life a little smarter or more joyful.
I also love connecting with people on similar paths. I regularly mentor students exploring engineering, product, AI, studying abroad, or making early-career decisions. I enjoy helping early-stage startups think through ideas, and I support NGOs and mission-driven teams whenever I can. If you'd like to chat, brainstorm, or explore mentorship, feel free to reach out.
I‚Äôm excited for what comes next and grateful that our paths crossed here.
---
about.tldr:
### _**tl;dr**_
_I design water systems by day, build AI tools by night, and chase a toddler in between._
_If there‚Äôs a messy business problem, I‚Äôll break it down._
_If there‚Äôs data, I‚Äôll analyze it._
_And if there‚Äôs an opportunity to use AI to make life easier, I‚Äôm already building it._
---

projects.title: Air France Search Advertising Optimization
projects.subtitle: Performance analytics (Excel + STATA)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Analyzed Air France‚Äôs paid search performance to identify which keywords, campaigns, and landing pages drive clicks, conversions, and revenue. Used CTR‚ÄìTCR bubble charts and keyword tables to diagnose gaps and optimization opportunities.
---
### **Problem**
Despite high click-through activity, 94% of searches resulted in zero bookings, revealing a breakdown between ad engagement and conversion. Air France needed data-backed insights to improve landing page performance, keyword ROI, and budget allocation.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Analytics Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Raw Search Data] --> B[Excel Cleaning]
B --> C[CTR/TCR Modeling]
C --> D[Keyword ROI Analysis]
D --> E[Insights]
E --> F[Ad & Landing Page Optimization]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Excel (cleaning, pivot tables, visualizations)
- STATA (regressions, KPI analysis)
- Regression & KPI modeling
- CTR/TCR analytics
- ROI & CPC analysis
---
### **Key Challenges**
- High CTR but zero-conversion keywords
- Large variance in CPC across brand vs generic keywords
- Branded campaigns massively outperforming geo-targeted campaigns
- Choosing the right levers (landing page vs keyword quality)
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to combine CTR, TCR, CPC, and ROI to diagnose funnel performance
- Why branded keywords deliver higher intent and better ROI
- How visual modeling (bubble charts) reveals hidden performance clusters
- How to translate marketing analytics into campaign strategy recommendations

projects.title: Billionaire Wealth & Economic Trends Dashboard
projects.subtitle: Global wealth analytics (Tableau + economic indicators)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Built an interactive Tableau dashboard analyzing billionaire demographics, wealth distribution, and economic indicators using a global dataset. The visual story highlights industry dominance, age and gender patterns, and economic relationships across GDP, CPI, tax rates, and billionaire concentration.
---
### **Problem**
Policymakers and business analysts struggle to understand how billionaire wealth evolves across industries, countries, and economic conditions. The dataset is large and multi-dimensional, requiring clear visual storytelling to extract trends and support economic insight.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Dashboard Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Raw Kaggle Dataset] --> B[Data Cleaning in Tableau Prep]
B --> C[Tableau Dashboards]
C --> D[Industry & Country Visuals]
C --> E[Demographics]
C --> F[Economic Indicators]
F --> G[Insights & Trend Story]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Tableau Desktop (multi-chart dashboard design)
- Tableau Story (narrative insights)
projects.-_exploratory_charts:
bar charts, scatter plots, maps, heatmaps
- KPI segmentation (industry, gender, age, country)
- Economic correlation analysis (GDP, CPI, tax rates)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Combining demographic, industry, and economic variables into one narrative
- Designing intuitive visual comparisons across countries and industries
- Showing economic correlations without overfitting the visuals
- Ensuring clarity while integrating dashboards (country, demographics, macro trends)
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to blend demographic and economic indicators in a unified visual story
- How to apply visual hierarchy to guide users through complex insights
- How to interpret GDP/CPI relationships using scatter and regression visuals
- How emerging markets (India, China) shift global billionaire distribution
---

projects.title: Chocolate Sales Insights Report
projects.subtitle: Sales analysis and forecasting
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Analyzed a dataset of 5,000+ sales records to identify revenue drivers and market trends across regions and product lines.
---
### **Problem**
Sales volume declined by 86.11% over the period. The business needed to investigate external market factors or internal issues and optimize inventory, pricing, and marketing to reverse the drop.
---
### **Key Findings**
projects.-_sales_forecasting: Significant decline in sales volume (-86.11%); immediate intervention required.
projects.-_customer_behavior: Top markets are Australia, UK, and India‚Äîprioritize marketing spend here.
projects.-_market_trends:
Preferences vary by region (e.g., Australia favors 50% Dark Bites, UK prefers Peanut Butter Cubes).
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Python
- Pandas (data cleaning and analysis)
- Seaborn (visualization)
---
### **Impact**
- Built a data cleaning pipeline to fix currency and date issues, improving data quality end to end.
- Created visualizations of monthly trends and top products to guide inventory decisions.
- Automated data acquisition and reporting, reducing manual analysis time.

projects.title: Cinemex Demand & Pricing Strategy Analysis
projects.subtitle: Price elasticity and competitive response modeling
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Analyzed how competitor 2-for-1 pricing impacted Cinemex attendance in Mexico City. Built counterfactuals, time-series graphs, demand curve diagrams, and regressions to quantify lost demand and evaluate Cinemex‚Äôs pricing response.
---
### **Problem**
Attendance dropped after competitors launched aggressive Wednesday 2-for-1 pricing. Needed to isolate the causal impact of competitor pricing and decide whether Cinemex should match the promotion.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Analysis Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Attendance & Pricing Data 2000‚Äì2002] --> B[Time Series Analysis]
B --> C[Demand Curve Modeling]
C --> D[Counterfactual Construction]
D --> E[Multiple Regression Control Model]
E --> F[Elasticity Estimation]
F --> G[Pricing Recommendation]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Excel (time-series, percent-change analysis, scenario modeling)
- Economic modeling (demand curves, substitution effects)
- Multiple regression (controls for seasonality and city-wide demand)
- Counterfactual simulation
- Price elasticity calculations
- Competitive strategy analysis
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Heavy seasonality in cinema attendance
- Confounding factors (holidays, heat waves, new releases)
- Limited 2.5 years of data available
- High correlation between city-wide and Cinemex attendance
- Sparse competitor pricing data beyond the 2-for-1 deal
---
### **What I Learned**
- Competitor 2-for-1 pricing reduced Cinemex‚Äôs Wednesday attendance by ~22%
- Cinemex‚Äôs own 2-for-1 introduction boosted winter attendance by ~27.5%
- Cinemex Wednesday demand is highly elastic (Œµ ‚âà 4‚Äì6)
- Counterfactual modeling is crucial for isolating causal impact
- Matching competitor pricing was strategically the right move

projects.title: Digital Strategy ‚Äî Trunk Tools
projects.subtitle: AI-native construction strategy
projects.categories: Product Management + UX, Strategy & Consulting Projects
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Strategic analysis of Trunk Tools, an AI-native construction startup building vertical LLM models for field productivity. Evaluated market fit, competitive landscape, workflow integration, and produced a roadmap for product, GTM, and data moat expansion.
---
### **Problem**
Construction is a $16.4T industry with chronic productivity issues, fragmented workflows, and labor shortages. Teams lose hours searching documentation, reviewing submittals, and coordinating schedules. Traditional construction software is not AI-native and fails to serve field workers effectively.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (AI Agent Stack)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Docs["RFIs, Specs, Drawings, Schedules"] --> ETL["Document Intelligence Pipeline"]
ETL --> VertLLM["Vertical LLM (Construction-trained)"]
VertLLM --> Agents["AI Agents: TrunkText / TrunkSubmittal / TrunkSchedule"]
Agents --> Mobile["Field Worker Mobile Interface"]
Agents --> PM["Project Manager Dashboard"]
Mobile --> Feedback["Jobsite Feedback Loop"]
PM --> Feedback
Feedback --> Retrain["Model Retraining + Continuous Learning"]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Construction-specific LLMs
- Vision + document parsing (OCR, PDF parsers)
- Embeddings over drawings, RFIs, submittals
- ETL pipeline for schedules and documents
- Mobile-first UX
projects.-_integrations:
Procore, Autodesk, Bluebeam
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Understanding workflow reality of jobsite teams
- Mapping each AI agent to measurable ROI metrics
- Evaluating PMF in a highly fragmented industry
- Benchmarking Trunk against Procore, Autodesk, OpenSpace
- Identifying markets for expansion (Canada, UK, Australia)
---
### **What I Learned**
- How vertical LLMs outperform general-purpose LLMs in industry use cases
- How to build a product and market segmentation strategy
- How AI can replace documentation work, not workers
- How to think like a PM building for safety-critical environments
- How to structure a GTM plan for an enterprise AI startup
---

projects.title: Email Summarizer using n8n
projects.subtitle: Automated weekly digest of top emails with AI
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Fully automated email intelligence agent that reads the top 50 emails each week, extracts themes, action items, and reminders, and sends a structured summary to the user.
---
### **Problem**
Professionals spend hours triaging inboxes, often missing critical to-dos hidden inside long threads. A lightweight, automated summarizer reduces cognitive load and improves task prioritization.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Email Digest Workflow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Cron[Weekly Cron Trigger] --> Gmail["Fetch 50 Emails"]
Gmail --> LLM["OpenAI Summarizer"]
LLM --> Organizer["Categorize: Highlights / To-Dos / Reminders"]
Organizer --> EmailNode[Email Sender]
EmailNode --> User
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- n8n
- Gmail API
- GPT models
- Cron schedules
- Email node (SMTP)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Avoiding invented tasks ("hallucinated action items")
- Handling duplicate content in long threads
- Designing summaries that render cleanly on mobile
- Ensuring reliable weekly execution
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to design multi-step agentic workflows
- How prompt engineering affects action-item extraction
- How to balance completeness and brevity
- How to deliver recurring automation with reliability
---

projects.title: FEMA Companion
projects.subtitle: AI knowledge assistant for seismic design (RAG)
projects.overview:
--- ### **Overview** Retrieval-Augmented Generation tool that makes **FEMA P-750** and **NIST GCR 2016** seismic design guidelines fully searchable. Engineers can ask natural-language questions and receive precise, citation-backed answers. --- ### **Problem** Seismic codes are dense, technical, and difficult to navigate. Engineers spend time manually searching hundreds of pages and often miss important clauses. There was no fast, authoritative, clause-level lookup grounded directly in source documents. --- ### **Architecture Diagram (High-Level RAG Pipeline)** ```mermaid flowchart LR A[User] --> B[Query Handler] B --> C[Vector Search] C --> D["Document Chunks
(FEMA / NIST)"] D --> E[Embeddings] E --> F[LLM Reasoning] F --> G["Final Answer
+ Citations"] ``` --- ### **Tech Stack** - LangChain - ChromaDB - OpenAI embeddings - GPT models - Python / Streamlit - PDF parsing with `pypdf` --- ### **Key Challenges** - Designing chunk sizes for technical engineering text - Preventing LLM hallucinations with strict grounding constraints - Ensuring consistent citation mapping - Handling mixed-format engineering documents --- ### **What I Learned** - How to build a complete RAG system end to end - How retrieval quality affects answer accuracy and trustworthiness - How to design usable AI tools for domain experts - How to enforce accuracy and grounding in engineering workflows ---

projects.title: HR Analytics Dashboard
projects.subtitle: Workforce insights (Tableau + HR metrics)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Interactive Tableau HR Insights Dashboard covering employee performance, salary distribution, engagement levels, and attrition patterns. Leaders can explore workforce trends and uncover actionable insights for retention and performance management.
---
### **Problem**
HR teams and senior leadership often lack a unified view of workforce data. Disconnected systems make it difficult to understand turnover, performance gaps, and compensation fairness. This dashboard consolidates critical HR metrics into a single, intuitive interface.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Dashboard Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Employee Dataset] --> B[Data Cleaning in Tableau Prep]
B --> C[Tableau Dashboard Build]
C --> D[Salary Visualization]
C --> E[Performance Scoring]
C --> F[Engagement & Satisfaction Metrics]
F --> G[Insights for HR Strategy]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Tableau Desktop (interactive charts and filters)
- Employee segmentation (department, gender, performance)
- KPI visualizations (attrition, satisfaction, salary ranges)
- Calculated fields for performance/engagement scores
- Dashboard actions and filters for cross-interaction
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Balancing simplicity with detail across multiple HR metrics
- Designing comparisons across departments with uneven sample sizes
- Showing engagement and satisfaction ratings clearly across ranges
- Enabling HR leaders to quickly drill into specific segments
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to design HR dashboards for executives
- How to blend performance, salary, and engagement metrics
- How visual comparisons uncover patterns tied to attrition
- How to create an end-to-end Tableau workflow from raw data to story
---

projects.title: JobSafetyAI
projects.subtitle: Construction safety AI in under 1 hour
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Built a construction safety AI in under one hour using Antigravity. Upload a construction site photo and instantly see: üü¢ Hardhat / üî¥ No Hardhat, üü¢ Safety Vest / üî¥ No Safety Vest, üò∑ Masks, üöß Machinery, üî∂ Cones, and more‚Äîeach with bounding boxes, confidence scores, and compliance summaries.
---
### **Problem**
projects.needed_an_end-to-end_construction_safety:
üìÇ Use a Kaggle dataset of construction site images
üß† Train a custom YOLOv8 object detection model
ü¶∫ Detect PPE compliance (hardhats, vests, masks, etc.)
üåê Run in a real-time Streamlit web app
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Antigravity (Google DeepMind)
- Kaggle dataset
- YOLOv8 (object detection)
- Streamlit (web app)
- Python
---
### **What I Learned**
If you have ideas but feel limited by your coding skills, Antigravity removes that barrier. It feels like having a world-class developer guiding you end to end‚Äîand it‚Äôs currently free and incredibly powerful.
---

projects.title: Life Expectancy Regression Analysis
projects.subtitle: Statistical modeling of health outcomes (Minitab)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Conducted a statistical analysis to understand how BMI and years of schooling influence global life expectancy using WHO and Kaggle data. Applied scatterplots, descriptive statistics, normality tests, simple regression, multiple regression, and model selection criteria (AICC and Adjusted R¬≤).
---
### **Problem**
Countries struggle to identify which socio-economic factors most strongly impact population health. Life expectancy varies widely, and policymakers need quantitative guidance on which levers‚Äîeducation, lifestyle, or healthcare‚Äîdrive outcomes.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Analysis Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[WHO Life Expectancy Dataset] --> B[Scatterplots & Outlier Detection]
B --> C[Normality Tests & Transformations]
C --> D[Simple Regression Models]
C --> E[Multiple Regression Model]
E --> F[Model Comparison (AICC, Adj R¬≤)]
F --> G[Insights for Policy & Intervention]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Minitab (regression, normality testing, visual diagnostics)
- Excel (initial cleaning and scatterplots)
- Simple and multiple linear regression
- AICC model selection
- Residual and leverage diagnostics
- Statistical inference (p-values, confidence intervals)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Response variable (life expectancy) not normally distributed
- Non-constant variance in residual plots
- BMI had weak explanatory power compared to schooling
- Outliers (e.g., Sierra Leone) skewed model behavior
- Choosing the best model when predictors were correlated
---
### **What I Learned**
- Schooling is a far stronger predictor of life expectancy than BMI
- Multiple regression improves explanatory power significantly
- Outlier and normality checks are critical for reliable inference
- Model selection requires balancing statistics with theory
- Socio-economic enablers (education, health spending) matter more than BMI alone

projects.title: Mobile App Rank Drivers
projects.subtitle: Demand modeling and price elasticity (STATA)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Built statistical models to identify key drivers of mobile app rank across Apple and Google stores. Used Negative Binomial Regression and log-log models to estimate how price, ratings, file size, screenshots, and monetization features impact app demand.
---
### **Problem**
App developers struggle to understand which attributes actually influence store ranking and downloads. With thousands of competing apps, knowing which levers move rank is critical for optimizing visibility and revenue.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Modeling Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Raw App Data] --> B[Variable Engineering]
B --> C[STATA Regression Models]
C --> D[Elasticity Estimation]
D --> E[Insights for App Store Optimization]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- STATA (nbreg, log-log regression, device segmentation)
- Excel (initial cleaning and summaries)
- Elasticity modeling
- Market segmentation (Apple vs Google, US vs China, Tablet vs Smartphone)
- KPI modeling (rank, downloads, ratings)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Overdispersed count data requiring NBREG instead of Poisson
- Significant cross-market elasticity differences (US vs China)
- Interpreting log-log coefficients as elasticities
- Complex interaction effects (device type √ó monetization model)
---
### **What I Learned**
- Pricing hurts Google users but can improve downloads for Apple users
- File size signals ‚Äúquality‚Äù to Apple users, improving rank
- Rating count is the strongest universal predictor of app success
- In-app purchases boost rank on smartphones but not tablets

projects.title: Morningstar ‚Äî Climate Index Construction
projects.subtitle: ESG and regulatory analysis
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Led the market and regulatory analysis for a climate-aligned European equity index. Integrated Morningstar and Sustainalytics ESG datasets to create a forward-looking, regulatory-aligned index methodology.
---
### **Problem**
Existing ESG indexes rely on backward-looking emissions and opaque scoring. Investors want transparent, forward-looking climate indexes aligned to EU Taxonomy, SFDR, and TCFD standards.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Index Methodology)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Universe[Morningstar Global All-Cap Index] --> Filter1[Exclude Firms Failing Climate Criteria]
Filter1 --> Metrics[Forward-Looking Metrics: Aligned CapEx, Aligned Revenue, SBTi Target, TCFD Disclosure, Management Quality]
Metrics --> Score[Composite Climate Score]
Score --> Weight[Weighted Rebalancing Framework]
Weight --> Index[Morningstar Climate Transition Index]
Index --> QA[Backtesting ‚Ä¢ Diversification ‚Ä¢ Risk Checks]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Morningstar Direct
- Sustainalytics ESG data
- Python for scoring and weighting
- EU Taxonomy, SFDR, CSRD regulatory frameworks
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Missing Scope 3 data
- Inconsistent TCFD reporting
- Designing methodology that is both investable and climate-aligned
- Balancing large-cap dominance vs mid/small cap representation
- Avoiding greenwashing
---
### **What I Learned**
- How ESG index construction works behind the scenes
- How climate regulations directly shape financial products
- How to design transparent scoring methodologies
- How forward-looking metrics outperform pure emissions data

projects.title: ParentPal ‚Äì Custom GPT
projects.subtitle: Safety-aligned parenting companion (AAP-grounded)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
ParentPal is an empathetic, safety-aligned AI parenting assistant grounded entirely in HealthyChildren.org (American Academy of Pediatrics). It delivers reliable, age-appropriate guidance for new parents.
---
### **Problem**
Parents are overwhelmed by contradictory online information. They need trusted, source-based advice‚Äîand AI models require strict guardrails to avoid unsafe recommendations.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Custom GPT with Safety Layer)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
User --> GPT[Custom GPT]
GPT --> Rules["System Prompt: Safety + AAP-only Sources"]
Rules --> Healthy[HealthyChildren.org Articles]
Healthy --> GPT
GPT --> User
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- OpenAI Custom GPT builder
- Safety guardrails + structured prompts
- HealthyChildren.org corpus
- Retrieval constraints
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Enforcing strict guardrails for medical-adjacent topics
- Designing empathetic yet factual responses
- Ensuring citations map to approved AAP content
- Maintaining consistency across age groups
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to design AI for safety-critical domains
- How to structure system prompts with constraints
- How to build trust through transparency
- How empathy shapes UX in family-oriented tools
---

projects.title: Philippines Macroeconomic Analysis
projects.subtitle: Growth drivers and economic resilience (FRED + World Bank)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Performed a comprehensive macroeconomic analysis of the Philippines using 30 years of data from FRED, World Bank, ADB, and trade datasets. Evaluated GDP growth, inflation, exports, productivity, sector composition, labor dynamics, and long-run economic prospects.
---
### **Problem**
Emerging markets like the Philippines show rapid yet volatile growth. Investors, governments, and retirement funds need structured, data-driven insights to assess stability, long-term prospects, and key macro risks.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Analysis Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[FRED + World Bank Data] --> B[GDP & Inflation Trends]
A --> C[Trade & Sector Analysis]
A --> D[Labor & Population Metrics]
D --> E[Growth Accounting]
E --> F[Risk Assessment & Investment Outlook]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- FRED datasets (GDP, CPI, unemployment, PPP)
- Trade and industry data (Atlas of Economic Complexity)
- Excel (trend charts, time-series analysis)
- Growth accounting framework
- Comparative analysis vs peer economies
- Macro risk assessment (inflation, demographics, debt)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Large multi-source datasets with differing time ranges
- Distinguishing structural vs cyclical growth drivers
- Interpreting conflicting signals (falling fertility vs rising GDP)
- Connecting population trends to productivity forecasts
- Assessing geopolitical exposure (U.S.‚ÄìChina dynamics)
---
### **What I Learned**
- The strongest growth driver is TFP plus labor force expansion
- Remittances (8% of GDP) stabilize the economy during downturns
- A booming BPO sector makes the country a ‚Äútiger economy‚Äù
- Aging population and low capital investment pose long-term risks
- The 20-year growth outlook is strong with high investor potential

projects.title: SalesSense AI
projects.subtitle: Real-time sales intelligence agent (RAG + automation)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
AI agent that ingests sales files from shared drives, embeds them into a vector database, and enables conversational analysis of KPIs, performance trends, and competitor insights.
---
### **Problem**
Sales ops teams juggle scattered PDFs, Excel files, and decks. Answering even basic questions about growth or retention requires time-consuming manual work and often yields incomplete insights.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Sales RAG System)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Drive Folder] --> B[n8n Ingestion Pipeline]
B --> C[Embedding Pipeline]
C --> D[Vector DB]
D --> E[LLM Answer Engine]
E --> F[Chat UI]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Python
- n8n automation
- Pinecone
- LangChain
- GPT models
- Streamlit UI
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Normalizing messy sales files before embedding
- Ensuring accurate KPI extraction across inconsistent schemas
- Updating embeddings as new files arrive without downtime
- Avoiding hallucinations when data is incomplete or missing
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to operationalize data ingestion for business users
- How RAG behaves with structured vs. unstructured data
- How to design explainability into business AI tools
- How to balance transparency with speed
---

projects.title: ScentScout ‚Äî Perfume Aggregator
projects.subtitle: Smart fragrance marketplace strategy
projects.categories: Strategy & Consulting Projects, Product Management + UX
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Data-driven business plan for **ScentScout**, a platform that helps fragrance enthusiasts find the best deals on luxury perfumes by aggregating listings from high-volume sellers.
---
### **Problem**
- High retail markups on luxury perfumes
- Fragmented grey market where authentic deals exist but trustworthy sellers are hard to find
- Opaque pricing that varies by 50%+ depending on seller and location
---
### **Solution**
A curated marketplace that vets sellers, tracks price drops, and guarantees authenticity.
projects.-_vets_sellers: Only lists items from verified hubs (Dallas, NJ).
projects.-_price_tracking: Alerts for ‚ÄúPrice Mistakes‚Äù on top brands.
projects.-_revenue_model:
Affiliate commissions plus $5/mo premium subscriptions.
---
### **Tech Stack / Approach**
- Business strategy
- Market analysis
- Revenue modeling
- Operational planning
---
### **Impact**
- Designed a scalable aggregator model with low inventory risk
- Identified key logistics hubs (Dallas, NJ, Brooklyn) for supply partnerships
- Created a three-phase operational roadmap from MVP to international expansion

projects.title: Search Engine Ad Ranking Model
projects.subtitle: Paid search analytics with STATA
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Built regression models to predict ad rank using auction variables including CTR, bid price, ad quality, landing page quality, retailer/brand presence, and daily effects. Achieved high explanatory power for CTR (Adj. R¬≤ = 0.91) and strong Ad Rank improvements when incorporating date effects.
---
### **Problem**
Brands waste ad spend because they don‚Äôt know which factors actually improve their paid search ranking. They need evidence on what drives Google Ad Rank to optimize bidding, creative, and landing page strategy.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Modeling Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
A[Ad Performance Data] --> B[Log Transformations]
B --> C[OLS Model (CTR Drivers)]
C --> D[OLS Model (Ad Rank)]
D --> E[Date Fixed Effects Model]
E --> F[Optimization Strategy]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- STATA (OLS regressions, fixed effects modeling)
- Excel (data prep & summaries)
- CTR & Ad Rank predictive modeling
- Log transformations for elasticity
- Model comparison (baseline vs date-adjusted)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Very strong autocorrelation (lagged CTR dominates predictions)
- Low R¬≤ for initial Ad Rank model without time-based factors
- Non-significant variables (ad quality, landing quality) despite importance
- Identifying daily search competition effects using fixed effects
---
### **What I Learned**
- CTR is primarily driven by past CTR (reinforcement effect)
- Bid price, CTR, brand presence, and retailer names are strong Ad Rank drivers
- Daily variations significantly change Ad Rank, improving accuracy by +7.5%
- How to translate statistical modeling into actionable paid search recommendations

projects.title: Submittal AI
projects.subtitle: AI-powered submittal reviewer (Gemini Pro 3)
projects.categories: AI / Machine Learning Projects, Product Management + UX
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Built SubmittalCheck AI‚Äîan AI-powered submittal reviewer that reads PDFs, checks completeness, flags spec deviations, and drafts engineer-ready comments using Google AI Studio and Gemini Pro 3.
---
### **Problem**
Submittal reviews are slow, manual, and error-prone. Engineers spend hours scanning specs, drawings, cut sheets, and certifications, and often miss attachments or conflicting details. Most AEC teams lack a lightweight tool that automates extraction, completeness checks, compliance review, and draft comments.
---
### **Solution**
projects.-_upload_pdf: Reads text, tables, scanned pages, cut sheets
projects.-_analyze: Extracts submittal number, spec section, product, model; checks for missing certificates/calcs; performs spec compliance and deviation checks
projects.-_draft_response:
Generates engineer-ready comments and recommended status (Approved / Approved as Noted / Revise & Resubmit / Rejected)
- Auto-logs everything into Google Docs and Sheets
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Gemini Pro 3.0
- Google AI Studio
- Google Extensions (Docs + Sheets)
- Google PDF/Document Processing
- React + Tailwind (UI)
---
### **What I Learned**
The breakthrough wasn‚Äôt PDF parsing‚Äîit was giving the AI agentic capabilities. With Google Search Grounding and external tool calls, the AI can verify details like a junior engineer: ‚ÄúIs this model discontinued?‚Äù ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the latest ASTM standard?‚Äù ‚ÄúDoes this product match the spec?‚Äù We‚Äôre moving from ‚ÄúAI as a wrapper‚Äù to ‚ÄúAI as an agent.‚Äù
---

projects.title: Tao Climate ‚Äî Carbon Removal Pricing
projects.subtitle: Market entry and pricing strategy
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Developed a pricing and market-entry strategy for hemp-based carbon credits offered by Tao Climate‚Äîa climate-tech startup in the XPRIZE Top 100 for carbon removal.
---
### **Problem**
Airlines must decarbonize but face cost pressure and uncertainty around voluntary carbon markets. Tao Climate needed to price hemp-based credits competitively while differentiating from DAC, enhanced weathering, BECCS, and biochar.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Pricing Strategy Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Market[Global Carbon Market Data] --> Compare[Competitor Benchmarking]
Airlines[Airline Sustainability Requirements] --> Compare
Compare --> Model[Pricing + ROI Model]
Model --> Scenarios[Low / Mid / High Price Scenarios]
Scenarios --> Recs[Final Pricing Strategy]
Supply[Hemp Cultivation + Production Costs] --> Model
Demand[Buyer WTP] --> Model
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Excel and Python pricing model
- Industry benchmarking (Climeworks, Charm, Puro.earth, Nori, Vesta)
- Airline sustainability reports (SBTi, SAF disclosures)
- Market sizing and segmentation frameworks
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Inconsistent carbon credit quality and verification
- VCM price volatility ($15 ‚Üí $800 depending on methodology)
- Mapping airline sustainability maturity models
- Identifying willingness to pay for nature-based vs engineered credits
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to build a defensible pricing model for an emerging market
- How buyers evaluate carbon credits (durability, MRV, co-benefits)
- How to position a niche product in a skeptical market
- How to design market segmentation for enterprise buyers

projects.title: Telco Customer Churn Prediction
projects.subtitle: ML and deep learning pipeline
projects.categories: AI / Machine Learning Projects, Data + Business Analytics / BI Systems
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Built an end-to-end pipeline on the Telco Customer Churn dataset. Compared logistic regression, random forest, and neural networks to predict churn and explain the drivers.
---
### **Problem**
Subscription businesses need to spot at-risk customers early, but most rely on manual analysis or non-predictive dashboards. Telecom companies lose millions annually from preventable churn.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Modeling Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Raw[Raw CSV] --> ETL[Python ETL: Cleaning + Encoding + Scaling]
ETL --> Features[Feature Engineering]
Features --> LogReg[Logistic Regression]
Features --> RF[Random Forest]
Features --> ANN[Neural Network]
LogReg --> Eval[Evaluation]
RF --> Eval
ANN --> Eval
Eval --> Insights[Business Recommendations]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Python (Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib)
- scikit-learn
- TensorFlow / Keras (ANN model)
- Power BI (visualization)
- AI Studio for experimentation
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Handling categorical variables via one-hot encoding
- Preventing data leakage during scaling
- Balancing interpretability (logistic regression) vs performance (RF/ANN)
- Visualizing churn drivers clearly for stakeholders
- Class imbalance and ANN overfitting risk
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to build ML pipelines end to end
- How to compare classic ML vs neural networks
- How feature engineering impacts model outcomes
- How to turn model results into business insights
- ML vs DL tradeoffs
---

projects.title: TripAdvisor Reviews Analysis
projects.subtitle: ML sentiment and strategy
projects.categories: AI / Machine Learning Projects, Data + Business Analytics / BI Systems
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Analyzed TripAdvisor reviews to identify patterns in sentiment, ratings, review length, and traveler type. Developed recommendations for improving engagement and platform design.
---
### **Problem**
TripAdvisor receives millions of reviews, but inconsistent sentiment and long-tail content make it hard for users to find helpful insights. The company needs ML-backed insights to improve UX and product decisions.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (NLP Pipeline)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Raw[TripAdvisor Dataset] --> Clean[Data Cleaning: stopwords, duplicates]
Clean --> NLP[Sentiment Analysis + Keyword Extraction]
NLP --> Clusters[Clustering: review themes]
Clean --> Model[Rating Prediction Model]
Model --> Insights[Business Insights + UX Recs]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Python (Pandas, NLTK, scikit-learn)
- Sentiment analysis
- Regression for rating prediction
- Visualization in Matplotlib / Power BI
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Noisy text and mixed sentiment (including sarcasm)
- Identifying segments (families vs couples vs solo travelers)
- Handling long-tail review content
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to extract business insights from unstructured text
- How ML models behave with subjective sentiment data
- How to translate data findings into product recommendations

projects.title: Understand AI
projects.subtitle: Meeting memory assistant (RAG + reasoning AI)
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Understand.AI is an AI-powered meeting memory system built for software engineering teams. It provides fast recall of decisions, rationale, action items, and historical context by unifying transcripts, Slack threads, and notes into a single searchable intelligence layer. The system is designed to help engineers spend less time digging through fragmented documentation and more time building.
---
### **Problem**
Engineering teams lose hours each week trying to remember what was decided and where context lives. Information is scattered across Confluence, Jira, Slack, raw recordings, and personal notes‚Äîcausing rework, misalignment, and slowed execution. Teams need a trusted, centralized memory with timestamps, decision history, and explanation paths so they can retrieve context instantly.
---
### **Tech Stack**
- Claude AI (reasoning & summarization)
- ChatGPT (generation, correction, refinement)
- Loavable (AI workflow + orchestration)
- Vector search (semantic retrieval)
- Meeting transcription (audio ‚Üí text)
- Figma prototypes (UX flows, interaction design)
- Knowledge Graph (entity + decision linking, conceptual)
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Building trust through timestamps, source snippets, and uncertainty indicators
- Designing an intuitive search experience that returns context quickly without overwhelming the user
- Handling long transcripts while surfacing only the decisions, rationales, blockers, and action items
- Balancing summary clarity vs. completeness for engineering audiences
- Creating product-led growth loops for cross-team adoption in large orgs (e.g., shareable AI summaries)
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to design AI products specifically for developer workflows and cognitive patterns
- How trust signals (citations, timestamps, transcript excerpts, correction interfaces) dramatically improve adoption
- How to convert raw user pain points into validated UX flows through rapid prototyping
- How PLG motions differ between engineering tools and consumer AI products
- How to shape an AI product around reliability, transparency, and low-friction recall

projects.title: Verra ‚Äî Sustainable Luxury Brand
projects.subtitle: AI-driven brand development
projects.categories: Product Management + UX, Strategy & Consulting Projects
projects.overview:
---
### **Overview**
Developed a complete luxury perfume brand from concept to market-ready pitch using generative AI and data analytics. Combined strategic market analysis with AI-powered creativity to create a full brand ecosystem.
---
### **Problem**
Traditional luxury fragrance brands lack transparency, while clean beauty brands often sacrifice luxury aesthetics. There was no brand serving the ‚ÄúByredo for the Eco-Conscious‚Äù niche‚Äîoffering premium design, emotional storytelling, and radical sustainability.
---
### **The Brand: Verra**
projects.-_positioning: Sustainable minimalist luxury for modern conscious youth
projects.-_product:
Verra 01: Rooted ‚Äî a woody citrus Eau de Parfum ($145)
---
### **Process**
1) Identity: Used ChatGPT to generate names and taglines, selecting ‚ÄúVerra‚Äù (Truth + Earth).
2) Visuals: Created minimalist, embossed logo and packaging concepts using Leonardo.ai.
3) Data: Analyzed 2,000 eBay listings to identify the ‚ÄúAffordable Luxury‚Äù gap ($43‚Äì$54 average).
4) Product: Designed the scent profile (Bergamot, Vetiver, Cedarwood) and zero-waste packaging (mushroom mycelium).
5) Campaign: Developed the ‚Äú#MyScentTruth‚Äù marketing campaign and pop-up launch strategy.
---
### **Architecture Diagram (Brand Build Flow)**
```mermaid
flowchart LR
Concept[AI Concept Generation] --> Identity[Brand Identity: Verra]
Identity --> Data[Market Analysis: Kaggle Dataset]
Data --> Product[Product Dev: Verra 01 Rooted]
Product --> Campaign[Marketing: #MyScentTruth]
Campaign --> Pitch[Investor Pitch: $500k Seed]
```
---
### **Tech Stack**
- ChatGPT (strategy and copy)
- Leonardo.ai (visual assets)
- Python/Pandas (market data analysis)
- Kaggle datasets
---
### **Key Challenges**
- Balancing luxury aesthetics with zero-waste materials
- Differentiating from established ‚Äúclean‚Äù brands like Henry Rose
- Justifying the $145 price point with data-driven insights
---
### **What I Learned**
- How to use AI as a creative partner for brand building
- The importance of data in validating creative decisions
- How to structure a comprehensive business pitch for a CPG product

resume.summary: Engineer-turned-strategist with 7+ years of experience designing complex infrastructure systems and building AI-enabled products. Combines structural engineering rigor with business analytics, product thinking, and hands-on AI development. Currently completing an MBA at NYU Stern, specializing in Business Analytics, Strategy, and Technology Product Management.

Data & Analytics: SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Python, R Studio, Excel, MATLAB, C++, Statistics, Data Visualization, Digital Marketing Analytics, AI Applications in Business

experience: Structural Engineer ‚Äî Carollo Engineers | Designed & managed multimillion-dollar water infrastructure projects; led cross-discipline coordination, construction support, and QA workflows; built dashboards and analytics tools used by design leadership; improved design review cycle time through data-driven process improvements.

Graduate Projects | NYU Stern School of Business; **Understand.AI ‚Äî AI Meeting Memory Product* ; - Designed LLM-powered meeting intelligence system; - Conducted user research & validation with engineering teams; - Built UX flows, trust features, and product strategy; **Tao Climate ‚Äî Carbon Removal Pricing Strategy* ; - Developed pricing strategy for hemp-based carbon credits; - Modeled airline willingness-to-pay & competitive positioning; - Presented recommendations at Google NY; **Morningstar ‚Äî Climate Index Strategy* ; - Built index methodology using Sustainalytics ESG data; - Modeled climate-aligned weighting scheme
education: MBA ‚Äî Business Analytics, Strategy, Tech Product Management | NYU Stern School of Business (2023‚Äì2026)

contact.title: Let's Connect
contact.body:
I'm always excited to connect with people working on innovative products, AI applications, and big strategic challenges.
I also enjoy supporting others on similar journeys. I regularly mentor students interested in engineering, product, AI, studying abroad, or navigating early-career decisions. I love helping early-stage startups brainstorm ideas, and I support mission-driven teams and NGOs whenever possible.
If you‚Äôd like to chat, explore mentorship, or simply brainstorm, I‚Äôd be happy to connect ‚Äî I‚Äôm usually available on weekends.
Looking forward to what's ahead ‚Äî and grateful that our paths have crossed.
